title: Former national chief says AFN lawsuit to move ahead, settlement talks 'stonewalled'

description: The federal government is escalating its fight with automotive giant Stellantis over the company's decision to move some production to the U.S., despite receiving hundreds of millions of dollars in Canadian taxpayer incentives in recent years.
title: Joly says feds will serve Stellantis with notice of default on funding contracts

description: Several members of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s cabinet addressed chiefs and delegates at the AFN Special Chiefs Assembly in Ottawa on Thursday. Chiefs had the opportunity to ask the ministers about First Nations priorities, including major projects and infrastructure, child welfare and community safety.
title: Where do First Nations rank on Carney’s priority list, regional chief asks ministers
Bloc says Liberals 'fear backlash' from removing religious exemptions in hate speech law

description: Two members of the federal government’s Net-Zero Advisory Body have resigned, saying its work is being ignored by Ottawa as it moves away from previous climate commitments and toward new oil and gas projects.
title: 2 top climate advisers quit saying Carney government is ignoring its experts

description: Next summer’s expanded tournament will feature 48 teams, and their wildly different rankings, as well as the state of global politics, has made the assembly of the 12 opening groups feel like a delicate proposition.
title: Canada's best- and worst-case scenarios for Friday's FIFA World Cup draw

description: U.S. President Donald Trump pardoned Tim Leiweke on Wednesday, five months after his own justice department indicted the former president and chief executive officer of Maple Leaf Sports and Entertainment.
title: Former MLSE boss Leiweke pardoned by Trump months after being indicted

description: The Independent Investigations Office of B.C. says there are not reasonable grounds to believe an officer committed any offence in the shooting death of a 15-year-old in Surrey earlier this year.
title: B.C. police watchdog clears officers in shooting death of 15-year-old in Surrey

description: An early start to Canada’s flu season is hitting children hard, sending a flood of young patients into multiple pediatric hospitals as medical teams warn that emergency visits and admissions could keep climbing in the weeks ahead.
title: Children’s hospitals in Canada face flood of flu visits as doctors urge families to get vaccinated

description: The Navy admiral who reportedly issued orders for the U.S. military to fire upon survivors of an attack on an alleged drug boat gave classified briefings to lawmakers. Pete Hegseth, the U.S. defence secretary, has been criticized this week over the boat strikes, as well as for an earlier controversy in which he communicated over an unsecured app.
title: Hegseth and Pentagon face heat after Signal chat report, briefing on deadly boat strike

description: A U.S. navy admiral told lawmakers on Thursday that there was no "kill them all" order from Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, but grave questions and concerns remain as Congress scrutinizes an attack that killed two survivors of an initial strike on an alleged drug boat in international waters near Venezuela.
title: U.S. admiral says there was no 'kill them all' order in boat attack facing Congress scrutiny

description: Spain and the Netherlands say they are pulling out of next year's Eurovision Song Contest as Israel's participation roils the competition.
title: Spain and the Netherlands pull out of 2026 Eurovision as Israel's participation roils contest

description: Pantone has just revealed its 2026 colour of the year, and it's, well, it's white. The pick not only surprised designers, but as some people are pointing out online, it's also a potentially loaded choice.
title: Pantone's 2026 colour of the year is white and some critics say the optics aren't great

description: The Parti Québécois's dominance in the polls for nearly two years and its leader Paul St-Pierre Plamondon's promise to hold a referendum on Quebec sovereignty during his first term have reverberated all the way to Ottawa.
title: Ottawa begins to consider the possibility of a Quebec referendum

description: The Canadian military is undertaking a structural reorganization designed to make the force more nimble and adaptable to new technology, the Department of National Defence said Thursday.
title: Learning lessons of Ukraine war, Canadian military creates joint command

description: Two Alberta cabinet ministers say money was a key factor in the United Conservative government's decision to use the Charter's notwithstanding clause to override teachers' rights and shut down a provincewide strike.
title: 2 Alberta cabinet ministers say money a key factor in using Charter override on teachers

description: The FBI has taken into custody a person suspected of planting pipe bombs in Washington the night before the Jan. 6, 2021, assault on the Capitol, a Justice Department official and another source briefed on the matter said on Thursday.
title: FBI arrests person suspected of planting pipe bombs on eve of U.S. Capitol riot, sources say
Trump could leave trade deal next year, top trade official says

description: President Vladimir Putin said in an interview published on Thursday that Russia would take full control of Ukraine's Donbas region by force unless Ukrainian forces withdraw — something Kyiv has flatly rejected.
title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force if it's not ceded by Ukraine

description: Since a B.C. Supreme Court judge ruled earlier this year that Aboriginal title coexists alongside fee simple title on around 125 privately-held parcels of land in Richmond, a question has hung over the case: why didn't the private landowners know the title to their property was up for debate?
title: 'It would be wrong': Why Richmond, B.C., residents weren't told about First Nation's claim to title
Retiree warns others after losing $3K to crypto fraud using AI video of prime minister

description: Steve Cropper, the lean, soulful guitarist and songwriter who helped anchor the celebrated Memphis backing band Booker T. and the M.G.'s at Stax Records and co-wrote the classics Green Onions, (Sittin' on) the Dock of the Bay and In t
title: Steve Cropper, legendary soul music songwriter and guitarist, dead at 84

description: A peek behind the curtain at how big players in the restaurant industry, who own multiple, seemingly independent restaurants, leverage better buying power as a way to survive post-COVID.
title: Chain restaurants are out. Restaurant groups are in

description: Nova Scotia health began a targeted recruitment drive immediately after the 2024 presidential election.
title: 4 U.S. nurse practitioners move to N.S. following recruitment drive

description: The first-degree murder trial of Brandy Cooney and Becky Hamber in Milton, Ont., heard texts in which the women questioned whether a boy in their care might be dying, a month before he did in December 2022.
title: A month before a boy in her care died, Ontario woman said she worried he'd die, trial hears

description: Imagine your toddler playing with a soft teddy bear, but with ChatGPT baked in. These AI toys can chat to your kid, play games and even say, "I love you." But experts are warning that we don’t know the long-term impacts to a child’s creativity and social development.
title: An AI toy meant for kids was happy to chat about sexual fetishes. Are these safe?

description: As platforms like Instagram, TikTok, Snapchat and YouTube begin to comply with Australia's new landmark law banning social media for those under 16, Aussie youth are likely starting to see pop-ups about their accounts being deactivated or put on hold. Is there a potential for ripple effects in Canada?
title: Australia's youth social media ban is looming. Could Canada roll out something similar?

description: Court documents filed by LSCDG obtained by CBC News show accusations of financial misconduct totalling $3 million by the Labour Sponsored Community Development Group's former executive director Anna Angelidis and two administrators she supervised: her sons Jim and Danny.
title: Family fired by Windsor, Ont., housing non-profit sued for millions

description: Food prices in Canada could increase by four to six per cent next year, largely led by pricier meat products, according to a forecast by researchers at Dalhousie University.
title: Food prices could increase in 2026, with meat leading the way, say Dalhousie researchers

description: A randomized controlled trial involving 12 weekly choir sessions for participants who have developed aphasia from strokes, aims to find out if singing together helps them re-gain their ability to speak and write.
title: How singing in a choir might help people find their voices after a stroke

description: In Jennifer McGuire's hometown in Ontario, plenty of women get Botox only when their partners are away during moose hunting season. That realization prompted her to grapple with why she, too, was hiding her own Botox use.
title: I felt people would judge me for getting Botox. Then I realized I was judging myself

description: While watching the World Series this fall, you may have noticed a series of ads from the Ontario government about the Ring of Fire, a mineral deposit in the James Bay lowlands that's long been eyed as a critical mineral source. Critics are speaking out about the use of stock footage in the ads, saying it doesn’t actually show the Ring of Fire. Here's what we found out.
title: Ontario's Ring of Fire ads include footage of Australia, Sweden and Russia

description: In Canada and the U.S., F1 has gone from niche motorsport to mainstream obsession in just a few years. It’s a shift driven by a new wave of fans who are remaking the sport's social media landscape and driving the call for representation.
title: Transforming F1: How the female and Gen Z fandom is shaping the sport’s future

description: From hit dramas like Stranger Things and The Summer I Turned Pretty, to attention grabbing reality shows, many shows on streaming platforms that made their name on binge watching are now releasing episodes weekly or in bite-sized chunks. Experts say the format and social factors are driving some fans to catch episodes when they air, though with more flexibility than broadcast TV allows.
title: Your favourite TV shows are changing how episodes are released. Is appointment viewing back?
Actual leader of the B.C. Conservatives up in the air — and so are their next moves
B.C. Conservative Party Leader John Rustad announces resignation
Interim leader takes over B.C. Conservative Party as John Rustad resigns
